name: Baptism
description: The sacrament of initiation into the Christian faith, performed through triple immersion in blessed water.

name: Chrismation
description: The anointing with Holy Chrism (Myrrh), sealing the gift of the Holy Spirit, usually performed immediately after Baptism.

name: Holy Eucharist
description: The central sacrament of the Orthodox Church â€” receiving the Body and Blood of Christ during the Divine Liturgy.

name: Confession
description: The sacrament of repentance and reconciliation, offering spiritual healing through dialogue with a priest.

name: Marriage
description: The sacred union of a man and woman, crowned as king and queen of their household in Christ.

name: Holy Unction
description: The anointing of the sick with blessed oil for spiritual and physical healing.

name: Ordination
description: The setting apart of men for the service of the Church as deacons, priests, or bishops.
